tasks.task_description: Configure interfaces Fa0/13-15 on SW1 and SW2 as one logical 802.1q trunk using EtherChannel. Configure interfaces Fa0/16-18 on SW2 and SW3 as one logical ISL trunk using EtherChannel. Configure interfaces Fa0/19-21 on SW3 and SW4 as one logical 802.1q trunk using EtherChannel. Do not use dynamic trunking or EtherChannel negotiation.
tasks.solution_config:
SW1:
interface FastEthernet0/13
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/14
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/15
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on

SW2:
interface FastEthernet0/13
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/14
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/15
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/16
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/17
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/18
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on

SW3:
interface FastEthernet0/16
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/17
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/18
 switchport trunk encapsulation isl
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/19
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/20
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/21
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 2 mode on

SW4:
interface FastEthernet0/19
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/20
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
!
interface FastEthernet0/21
 switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
 switchport mode trunk
 switchport nonegotiate
 channel-group 1 mode on
tasks.solution_verification:
SW2#show interfaces trunk

Port      Mode         Encapsulation  Status        Native vlan
Po1       on           802.1q         trunking      1
Po2       on           isl            trunking      1

SW2#show etherchannel summary
Flags:  D - down        P - in port-channel
        I - stand-alone s - suspended
        H - Hot-standby (LACP only)
        R - Layer3      S - Layer2
        U - in use      f - failed to allocate aggregator
        u - unsuitable for bundling
        w - waiting to be aggregated
        d - default port

Number of channel-groups in use: 2
Number of aggregators:           2

Group  Port-channel  Protocol    Ports
------+-------------+-----------+-----------------------------------------------
1      Po1(SU)          -        Fa0/13(P) Fa0/14(P) Fa0/15(P)
2      Po2(SU)          -        Fa0/16(P) Fa0/17(P) Fa0/18(P)

SW3#show interfaces trunk

Port      Mode         Encapsulation  Status        Native vlan
Po1       on           isl            trunking      1
Po2       on           802.1q         trunking      1

SW3#show etherchannel summary
Flags:  D - down        P - in port-channel
        I - stand-alone s - suspended
        H - Hot-standby (LACP only)
        R - Layer3      S - Layer2
        U - in use      f - failed to allocate aggregator
        u - unsuitable for bundling
        w - waiting to be aggregated
        d - default port

Number of channel-groups in use: 2
Number of aggregators:           2

Group  Port-channel  Protocol    Ports
------+-------------+-----------+-----------------------------------------------
1      Po1(SU)          -        Fa0/16(P) Fa0/17(P) Fa0/18(P)
2      Po2(SU)          -        Fa0/19(P) Fa0/20(P) Fa0/21(P)
corrections_made: Standardized all device names: 'sw1' → 'SW1', 'sw2' → 'SW2', 'SW3' → 'SW3', 'swA' → 'SW4'
Fixed interface naming: 'Fad/4' pattern corrected to 'Fa0/' format
Corrected trunk encapsulation: 'dotlg' → 'dot1q' for 802.1q trunks
Corrected trunk encapsulation: Changed 'dot1q' to 'isl' for SW2 Fa0/16-18 and SW3 Fa0/16-18 per task requirements
Fixed OCR errors in verification output: 'Rack1SW2#' → 'SW2#', 'Rack1SW3#' → 'SW3#'
Removed device prompts 'Rack1' from verification output
Fixed verification table formatting and alignment
Corrected EtherChannel summary output formatting and spacing
Fixed interface ranges in verification: 'Fa0/13(P) Fa0/14(P) —-Fa0/15(P.' → 'Fa0/13(P) Fa0/14(P) Fa0/15(P)'
Corrected truncated interface listings in verification output
Fixed flag descriptions in verification: '£ - failed to allocate aggregator' → 'f - failed to allocate aggregator'
Standardized interface naming in verification output
Corrected task description formatting and spacing
Fixed configuration command indentation and formatting
Ensured consistent use of 'dot1q' (not 'dotlq') throughout configuration

tasks.task_description:
Configure VLAN assignments as follows:
Device - Interface
R1 Fa0/0
R2 Fa0/0
R3 E0/1
R4 E0/0
R4 E0/1
R5 E0/0
R5 E0/1
R6 Gi0/0
**2 Points**
**15 Minutes**
tasks.solution_config:
SW1:
interface FastEthernet0/1
 switchport access vlan 136
!
interface FastEthernet0/3
 switchport access vlan 136
!
interface FastEthernet0/5
 switchport access vlan 54

SW2:
interface FastEthernet0/2
 switchport access vlan 2
!
interface FastEthernet0/4
 switchport access vlan 54
!
interface FastEthernet0/6
 switchport access vlan 136
!
interface FastEthernet0/24
 switchport access vlan 3

SW3:
vlan 2,3,7,48,57,136
!
interface FastEthernet0/3
 switchport access vlan 3
!
interface FastEthernet0/5
 switchport access vlan 57
!
interface FastEthernet0/24
 switchport access vlan 3
!
interface Vlan7
 ip address 156.1.7.9 255.255.255.0

SW4:
interface FastEthernet0/4
 switchport access vlan 48

tasks.task_description: Configure a Frame Relay connection between R1, R2, R4, and R5 using the DLCIs provided in the diagram. Use only the physical interfaces on R1 and R5. Use multipoint subinterfaces on R2 and R4. Use only one Frame Relay map statement on R2 and R4.
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
interface Serial0/0
 ip address 156.1.0.1 255.255.255.0
 encapsulation frame-relay
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.2 102 broadcast
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.5 105 broadcast
 no frame-relay inverse-arp

R2:
interface Serial0/0
 encapsulation frame-relay
 no frame-relay inverse-arp
!
interface Serial0/0.201 multipoint
 ip address 156.1.0.2 255.255.255.0
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.1 201 broadcast

R4:
interface Serial0/0
 encapsulation frame-relay
 no frame-relay inverse-arp
!
interface Serial0/0.405 multipoint
 ip address 156.1.0.4 255.255.255.0
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.5 405 broadcast

R5:
interface Serial0/0
 ip address 156.1.0.5 255.255.255.0
 encapsulation frame-relay
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.1 501 broadcast
 frame-relay map ip 156.1.0.4 504 broadcast
 no frame-relay inverse-arp
tasks.solution_verification:
R1#show frame-relay map
Serial0/0 (up): ip 156.1.0.2 dlci 102(0x66,0x1860), static,
              broadcast,
              CISCO, status defined, active
Serial0/0 (up): ip 156.1.0.5 dlci 105(0x69,0x1890), static,
              broadcast,
              CISCO, status defined, active

R2#show frame-relay map
Serial0/0.201 (up): ip 156.1.0.1 dlci 201(0xC9,0x3090), static,
                  broadcast,
                  CISCO, status defined, active

R4#show frame-relay map
Serial0/0.405 (up): ip 156.1.0.5 dlci 405(0x195,0x6450), static,
                  broadcast,
                  CISCO, status defined, active

R5#show frame-relay map
Serial0/0 (up): ip 156.1.0.1 dlci 501(0x1F5,0x7C50), static,
              broadcast,
              CISCO, status defined, active
Serial0/0 (up): ip 156.1.0.4 dlci 504(0x1F8,0x7C80), static,
              broadcast,
              CISCO, status defined, active
corrections_made: Fixed task description: 'DLCl’s' → 'DLCIs'
Standardized device names in verification output: 'Rack1Rl#' → 'R1#', 'Rack1R2#' → 'R2#', 'Rack1R4#' → 'R4#', 'Rack1R5#' → 'R5#'
Fixed OCR errors in verification output: 'Betive' → 'active', 'Beatie' → 'static', 'Btatie' → 'static', 'Betave' → 'active'
Standardized Frame Relay map type to lowercase 'static' in verification output
Fixed formatting in verification output to align tables and fix line breaks
Removed device prompts 'Rack1' from verification output
Fixed inconsistent capitalization in verification output (maintained proper case for commands)
Fixed OCR error in verification output: 'Betive' → 'active' (multiple instances)
Fixed OCR error in verification output: 'Beatie' → 'static' (multiple instances)
Fixed OCR error in verification output: 'Btatie' → 'static'
Fixed OCR error in verification output: 'Betave' → 'active'
Maintained consistent indentation in configuration commands
Fixed inconsistent spacing in configuration commands

tasks.task_description: Configure the Frame Relay connection between R6 and BB1 using the DLCI provided in the diagram.
tasks.solution_config:
R6:
interface Serial0/0/0
 encapsulation frame-relay
!
interface Serial0/0/0.101 point-to-point
 ip address 54.1.1.6 255.255.255.0
 frame-relay interface-dlci 101
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify L3 to L2 mapping and test connectivity:

R6#show frame-relay map
Serial0/0/0.101 (up): point-to-point dlci 101 (0x65, 0x1850), broadcast
              status defined, active

R6#ping 54.1.1.254
Type escape sequence to abort.
Sending 5, 100-byte ICMP Echos to 54.1.1.254, timeout is 2 seconds:
!!!!!
Success rate is 100 percent (5/5), round-trip min/avg/max = 32/32/32 ms
corrections_made: Standardized device name in verification output: 'Rack1R6#' to 'R6#'.
Corrected OCR errors in 'show frame-relay map' output: 'Boant-eoapoine aleiplalea 0d' to 'point-to-point dlci 101'.
Corrected OCR errors in 'show frame-relay map' output: 'Jetive' to 'active'.
Fixed formatting and spacing in verification output for readability.
Replaced '!!!!!' in ping output with the standard success indicator '!!!!!' (unchanged but clarified).
Removed 'Rack1' prefix from device prompts in verification output.
Ensured configuration commands are properly formatted with correct indentation.

tasks.task_description: Configure PPP on the Serial connection between R4 and R5
tasks.solution_config:
R4:
interface Serial0/1
 ip address 156.1.45.4 255.255.255.0
 encapsulation ppp

R5:
interface Serial0/1
 ip address 156.1.45.5 255.255.255.0
 encapsulation ppp
 clockrate 64000
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify connectivity:
R5#ping 156.1.45.4

Type escape sequence to abort.
Sending 5, 100-byte ICMP Echos to 156.1.45.4, timeout is 2 seconds:
!!!!!
Success rate is 100 percent (5/5), round-trip min/avg/max = 28/29/32 ms
corrections_made: Standardized device name in verification output: 'Rack1R5#' → 'R5#'
Removed OCR artifact 'Rack1' from device prompt
Added missing exclamation marks (!!!!!) to ping output for proper formatting
Maintained proper indentation in configuration commands

tasks.task_description: Configure CHAP authentication on R4 and R5. Use username ROUTER4 on R4 and ROUTER5 on R5 along with the password of CISCO.
tasks.solution_config:
R4:
username ROUTER5 password 0 CISCO
!
interface Serial0/1
ppp authentication chap
ppp chap hostname ROUTER4

R5:
username ROUTER4 password 0 CISCO
!
interface Serial0/1
ppp authentication chap
ppp chap hostname ROUTER5
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify PPP authentication:

R5#debug ppp authentication
PPP authentication debugging is on

R5#conf t
Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.

R5(config-if)#shutdown
R5(config-if)#

tasks.task_description: Configure SW3 so that it sends traffic for all destinations to SW1. Do not use static routing for this task.
tasks.solution_config:
SW3:
no ip routing
!
ip default-gateway 156.1.7.7
tasks.solution_verification:
SW3#show ip route
Default gateway is 156.1.7.7

Host               Gateway           Last Use    Total Uses  Interface
ICMP redirect cache is empty
corrections_made: Corrected device name 'sW3' to 'SW3' in solution configuration
Corrected device prompt 'Rack1SW3#' to 'SW3#' in verification output
Standardized verification output formatting with proper table alignment
Removed OCR artifact 'Rack1' from device prompt

tasks.task_description: Enable RIPv2 on R4, R5, and SW2. Advertise VLAN 8, 48, & 54 and SW2's Loopback0 into RIP. The administrative distance of RIP should be half of the default administrative distance on R4 and R5.
tasks.solution_config:
R4:
router rip
 version 2
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface Ethernet0/0
 no passive-interface Ethernet0/1
 network 156.1.0.0
 distance 60
 no auto-summary

R5:
router rip
 version 2
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface Ethernet0/0
 network 156.1.0.0
 distance 60
 no auto-summary

SW2:
ip routing
!
router rip
 version 2
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface Vlan48
 network 150.1.0.0
 network 156.1.0.0
 no auto-summary
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify RIP configuration:

R4#show ip protocols
Routing Protocol is "rip"
  Sending updates every 30 seconds, next due in 5 seconds
  Invalid after 180 seconds, hold down 180, flushed after 240
  Outgoing update filter list for all interfaces is not set
  Incoming update filter list for all interfaces is not set
  Redistributing: rip
  Default version control: send version 2, receive version 2
    Interface             Send  Recv  Triggered RIP  Key-chain
    Ethernet0/0           2     2
    Ethernet0/1           2     2
  Automatic network summarization is not in effect
  Maximum path: 4
  Routing for Networks:
    156.1.0.0
  Passive Interface(s):
    Serial0/0
    Serial0/0.405
    Serial0/1
    Loopback0
    VoIP-Null0

    Gateway         Distance      Last Update
    156.1.48.8          60      00:00:14
    156.1.54.5          60      00:00:13
  Distance: (default is 60)

R5#show ip protocols

  Sending updates every 30 seconds, next due in 28 seconds

  Incoming update filter list for all interfaces is not set

  Default version control: send version 2, receive version 2
    Interface             Send  Recv  Triggered RIP  Key-chain
    Ethernet0/0           2     2
  Automatic network summarization is not in effect
  Maximum path: 4
  Routing for Networks:
    156.1.0.0
  Passive Interface(s):
    Serial0/0
    Ethernet0/1
    Serial0/1
    Loopback0
    VoIP-Null0
  Routing Information Sources:
    Gateway         Distance      Last Update
    156.1.54.4          60      00:00:13
  Distance: (default is 60)

Verify RIP routes:

SW2#show ip route rip

R       156.1.0.0/24 [120/1] via 156.1.48.4, 00:00:03, Vlan48
R       156.1.57.0/24 [120/2] via 156.1.48.4, 00:00:03, Vlan48

R       156.1.45.0/24 [120/1] via 156.1.48.4, 00:00:03, Vlan48
R       156.1.45.5/32 [120/1] via 156.1.48.4, 00:00:03, Vlan48

Fixed typo: 'RS' → 'R5' in task description

Fixed missing quote in R4 show ip protocols output: '"rip' → '"rip"'

tasks.task_description: Configure R4 to generate a default route to SW2. This default should not be sent to R5. Do not use a distribute-list to accomplish this task.
tasks.solution_config:
R4:
router rip
 default-information originate route-map DEFAULT_TO_SW2

route-map DEFAULT_TO_SW2 permit 10
 set interface Ethernet0/1

tasks.task_description: The RIP updates sent between R4 and R5 across VLAN 54 should be sent with a destination IP address of 156.1.54.255. Do not use the neighbor command to accomplish this task.
tasks.solution_config:

interface Ethernet0/0

 ip broadcast-address 156.1.54.255
 ip rip v2-broadcast

tasks.task_description: Configure OSPF area 1245 between R1, R2, R4, and R5.

router ospf 1

 network 156.1.0.5 0.0.0.0 area 1245

tasks.task_description: Configure OSPF area 0 on the PPP connection between R4 and R5. Set the OSPF hello interval on the PPP connection to 2400 seconds.

!
router ospf 1
 network 156.1.45.4 0.0.0.0 area 0

R5:
interface Serial0/1
 ip ospf hello-interval 2400
!
router ospf 1
 network 156.1.45.5 0.0.0.0 area 0

tasks.task_description: Configure OSPF area 51 between R2, SW4, and BB2. Summarize the 156.X.0.0 network out towards SW4 and BB2. Use the most efficient summarization possible with the minimal amount of address overlap for your internal network.
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
router ospf 1
 area 1245 virtual-link 150.1.5.5
 area 1245 virtual-link 150.1.2.2

R2:
router ospf 1
 area 1245 range 156.1.0.0 255.255.0.0
 area 1245 virtual-link 150.1.1.1
 network 192.10.1.2 0.0.0.0 area 51

R5:
router ospf 1
 area 1245 virtual-link 150.1.1.1

tasks.task_description:
Configure OSPF area 57 between R5 and SW1.
Configure OSPF area 0 on VLAN 5 and 7.
OSPF area 57 should be a stub area. Do not use a GRE tunnel for this task.
tasks.solution_config:
R5:
interface Tunnel57
 ip unnumbered Serial0/1
 tunnel source 156.1.57.5
 tunnel destination 156.1.57.7
 tunnel mode ipip
!
router ospf 1
 area 57 stub
 network 156.1.57.5 0.0.0.0 area 57

SW1:
ip routing
!
interface Tunnel57
 ip unnumbered Vlan7
 tunnel source 156.1.57.7
 tunnel destination 156.1.57.5
 tunnel mode ipip
!
router ospf 1
 router-id 150.1.7.7
 area 57 stub
 network 156.1.7.7 0.0.0.0 area 0
 network 156.1.57.7 0.0.0.0 area 57
corrections_made: Standardized device name 'sw1' to 'SW1' in task description and configuration

tasks.task_description: Perform mutual redistribution between RIP and OSPF on R4 and R5.
tasks.solution_config:
R4, R5:
router ospf 1
 redistribute rip subnets
!
router rip
 redistribute ospf 1 metric 1
corrections_made: Corrected 'RS' to 'R5' in task description and solution configuration.
Standardized device names to proper case (R4, R5).
Fixed formatting and indentation of configuration commands.
Removed stray exclamation mark and ensured proper command structure.

tasks.task_description: Prevent route looping between RIP and OSPF on R4 and R5. Do not use administrative distance to accomplish this task.
tasks.solution_config:
R4,R5:
router ospf 1
 redistribute rip subnets route-map RIP_OSPF
 distance 59
!
router rip
 redistribute ospf 1 metric 1 route-map OSPF_RIP
!
route-map OSPF_RIP deny 10
 match tag 120
!
route-map OSPF_RIP permit 20
 set tag 110
!
route-map RIP_OSPF deny 10
 match tag 110
!
route-map RIP_OSPF permit 20
 set tag 120
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify full connectivity with the following Tcl script:
Full IGP reachability:

foreach i {
156.1.0.1
150.1.1.1
192.10.1.2
156.1.0.2
150.1.2.2
156.1.54.4
156.1.0.4
156.1.48.4
156.1.45.4
150.1.4.4
156.1.54.5
156.1.0.5
156.1.57.5
156.1.45.5
150.1.5.5
156.1.57.7
150.1.7.7
156.1.7.7
156.1.8.8
156.1.48.8
150.1.8.8
192.10.1.10
} { ping $i }

Note, that routers R3 and R6 are excluded from connectivity test. Also, VLAN 136 and VLAN 7 are not a part of any IGP.

tasks.task_description: Configure R1 to generate a default route into OSPF. This default should not be redistributed into RIP.
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
router ospf 1
 default-information originate

R4, R5:
ip prefix-list DEFAULT seq 5 permit 0.0.0.0/0
!
route-map OSPF_RIP deny 5
 match ip address prefix-list DEFAULT
corrections_made: Corrected 'default—information originate' to 'default-information originate' (hyphen correction)
Corrected 'RS:' to 'R5:' (device name standardization)
Fixed indentation for OSPF configuration command
Removed stray exclamation mark formatting artifact
Standardized route-map configuration formatting

tasks.task_description:
**Using a static route, configure a default on R1 pointing to 156.1.136.254.**
As long as R6’s DLCI 101 is active, R6 should be the HSRP primary router answering for this IP address.
If R6’s DLCI 101 becomes inactive or deleted, R3 should become the active router.

**1 Point**
**5 Minutes**
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 156.1.136.254

R3:
interface Ethernet0/0
 standby 1 ip 156.1.136.254
 standby 1 preempt

R6:
interface GigabitEthernet0/0
 standby 1 ip 156.1.136.254
 standby 1 priority 105
 standby 1 preempt
 standby 1 track Serial0/0/0.101
tasks.solution_verification:

Verify default route at R5:

R5#show ip route ospf

      156.1.0.0/16 is variably subnetted, 12 subnets, 3 masks

O        156.1.7.0/24 [110/11112] via 156.1.7.7, 00:06:20, Tunnel57
O        156.1.0.1/32 [110/64] via 156.1.0.1, 00:12:22, Serial0/0
O IA     156.1.0.0/16 [110/128] via 156.1.0.1, 00:00:00, Serial0/0
O        156.1.0.2/32 [110/128] via 156.1.0.1, 00:12:22, Serial0/0
O IA     192.10.1.0/24 [110/129] via 156.1.0.1, 00:06:20, Serial0/0
      150.1.0.0/16 is variably subnetted, 6 subnets, 2 masks
O        150.1.7.7/32 [110/11112] via 156.1.7.7, 00:06:20, Tunnel57
O        150.1.4.4/32 [110/65] via 156.1.0.4, 00:06:20, Serial0/0
O        150.1.2.2/32 [110/129] via 156.1.0.1, 00:06:20, Serial0/0
O        150.1.1.1/32 [110/65] via 156.1.0.1, 00:06:20, Serial0/0
O*E2 0.0.0.0/0 [110/1] via 156.1.0.1, 00:06:20, Serial0/0

Confirm that default route is not redistributed into RIP:

R4#show ip route rip | inc 0.0.0.0
R4#

Verify PVC status tracking at R6:

Meanwhile, at FR5, remove PVC 101:

tasks.task_description:
Configure BGP according to the protocol diagram on R1, R3, and R6.
eBGP peering should be done between AS 100 & AS 54, and AS 100 & AS 200.
iBGP peering should be done within AS 100.
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
router bgp 200
 bgp router-id 150.1.1.1
 neighbor 156.1.136.3 remote-as 100
 neighbor 156.1.136.6 remote-as 100

R3:
router bgp 100
 bgp router-id 150.1.3.3
 neighbor 156.1.136.1 remote-as 200
 neighbor 156.1.136.6 remote-as 100
 neighbor 204.12.1.254 remote-as 54

R6:
router bgp 100
 bgp router-id 150.1.6.6
 neighbor 54.1.1.254 remote-as 54
 neighbor 156.1.136.1 remote-as 200
 neighbor 156.1.136.3 remote-as 100
tasks.solution_verification:
Verify BGP peering:

R1#show ip bgp summary | beg Nei
Neighbor        V    AS MsgRcvd MsgSent   TblVer  InQ OutQ Up/Down  State/PfxRcd
156.1.136.3     4   100       8       7        0    0    0 00:01:15       10
156.1.136.6     4   100       8       5        0    0    0 00:01:17       10

R6#show ip bgp summary | beg Nei
Neighbor        V    AS MsgRcvd MsgSent   TblVer  InQ OutQ Up/Down  State/PfxRcd
54.1.1.254      4    54      10      10        0    0    0 00:02:08       10
156.1.136.1     4   200       5       8        0    0    0 00:01:59        0
156.1.136.3     4   100       8       8        0    0    0 00:01:57       10

R3#show ip bgp summary | beg Nei
Neighbor        V    AS MsgRcvd MsgSent   TblVer  InQ OutQ Up/Down  State/PfxRcd
156.1.136.1     4   200       8       9        0    0    0 00:02:23        0
156.1.136.6     4   100       9       9        0    0    0 00:02:23       10
204.12.1.254    4    54      10      10        0    0    0 00:02:32       10

Fixed device prompt 'Rack1R6#' to 'R6#' in verification output

Added missing column headers and standardized table format

Corrected '156.1.136.3 4100' to '156.1.136.3     4   100' in R6 verification (fixed column spacing)

tasks.task_description: Configure R1 to advertise the 156.X.0.0/24 network via BGP. Advertise the routes learned by OSPF on R1 via BGP. Configure R3 to advertise the 204.12.X.0/24 network and R6 to advertise the 54.1.X.0/24 network via BGP.
tasks.solution_config:
R1:
router bgp 200
 network 156.1.0.0 mask 255.255.255.0
 redistribute ospf 1

R3:
router bgp 100
 network 204.12.1.0
 network 150.1.3.0 mask 255.255.255.0

R6:
router bgp 100
 network 54.1.1.0 mask 255.255.255.0
 network 150.1.3.0 mask 255.255.255.0
corrections_made: Standardized device prompts: 'Rack1R6#' → 'R6#'
Fixed command formatting: 'show ip bgp quote-regexp *$ | beg Netw' → 'show ip bgp quote-regexp *$ | beg Network'
Fixed table alignment in verification output
Fixed missing subnet masks: '204.12.1.0' → '204.12.1.0/24' in verification output
Removed OCR artifacts: 'ecco e oOo oO Ooo OOo SOOO SCOOCOOSD', 'He be be', 'WWII DDB BW'
Fixed path column formatting and removed stray characters
Corrected inconsistent spacing in verification tables
Fixed malformed network entries: '41156.1.0.0' → '156.1.0.0/24'
Removed duplicate and malformed entries from verification output

tasks.task_description: Configure the network so that R1 will forward traffic learned via AS 100 to the active HSRP router within VLAN 136.
tasks.solution_config:
R3, R6:
router bgp 100
 neighbor 156.1.136.1 route-map CHANGE_NEXT_HOP out
!
route-map CHANGE_NEXT_HOP permit 10
 set ip next-hop 156.1.136.254
corrections_made: Fixed device name in verification output: 'Rack11R1l#' → 'R1#'
Fixed device name in verification text: 'RI' → 'R1'
Fixed route-map name in configuration: 'CHANGE _NEXT_HOP' → 'CHANGE_NEXT_HOP' (removed space)
Fixed BGP table formatting: aligned columns, corrected spacing in verification output
Fixed next-hop value in first row of verification output: 'MSeuiuisel254' → '156.1.136.254'
Fixed AS path values: standardized '544' and '100 544' patterns
Removed rack prefixes from device prompts: 'Rack11R1l#' → 'R1#'
Fixed command formatting in configuration section: added proper indentation for BGP neighbor command
Fixed verification command formatting: standardized 'show ip bgp' output alignment
Fixed network prefix display: ensured consistent spacing in BGP table
